New Records: Lockie Ferguson became the second bowler to deliver four maidens in a T20I match after Canada's Saad Bin Zafar in 2021
Key Match Events: Lockie Ferguson took 3 wickets and conceded 0 runs in his four overs, including a delivery that hit three stumps and two leg byes.
New Zealand won the match by 7 wickets with 46 balls remaining.
The match was delayed by an hour due to rain before the toss.
Pre-Game Insights: Kane Williamson decided to bat first due to the moisture in the pitch from the rain.
Papua New Guinea's batting struggled against the New Zealand bowlers, especially against Lockie Ferguson and Tim Southee.
Post-Match Reflections: Lockie Ferguson expressed sheepishness about his team-mates' congratulations but acknowledged the historical significance of his performance.
New Zealand's victory was seen as a dominant performance despite their earlier disappointing campaign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kabua Morea returned to the team and took 2 wickets for 4 runs in 2.2 overs, showing his redemption.
The match was the 39th match in the tournament.
